page.title: 14THE MANOR AT WOOLAVINGTON
page.content: A Manor has been at Woolavington since the{Norman Conquest,}the first owner being Robert de Candos,of Nether Stowey.The present house,some 500 years old,stands on the same site.The Wyburns bought the Manor in 1840,it stayed in the family for some 120 years.Within their grounds they built a{Sunday school}room.The Willets lived at the Manor until 1965. When a fireplace was removed a {priests hiding chamber was discovered. A heavy door from Bridgwater castle was found in the garage.The family grew their own fruit and vegetables.Mr Bob Willet was{cabinet maker. During the Goodenhoughs time the manor was split into 2 dwellings-manor Cottage and East wing.The Angus family moved into Manor cottage,he makes {stain glass windows.
